content:
• Wednesday, February 29, 2012
  • BID

    More on Sotheby's (NYSE:BID): Q4 misses estimates across the board. The auctioneer's profit...

    More on Sotheby's (NYSE:BID): Q4 misses estimates across the board. The auctioneer's profit slumped 26% on lower net auction sales, fewer single-owner sales and a significant decline in auction commission margins. Shares -8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:30 PM
  • WPRT

    More on Westport Innovations (NASDAQ:WPRT): FQ3 misses on a per share basis due to higher input...

    More on Westport Innovations (NASDAQ:WPRT): FQ3 misses on a per share basis due to higher input costs, but beats on overall revenue. Earnings soared 155% Y/Y with strong sales growth across all business lines. The company also raises revenue estimates for 2012, now expecting revenue to be between $400M - $425M. Street estimates are for $347M. Shares +2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:21 PM
  • PEGA

    More on Pegasystems' (NASDAQ:PEGA) Q4: Deferred revenue reached $89.2M, +7% Q/Q. Software...

    More on Pegasystems' (NASDAQ:PEGA) Q4: Deferred revenue reached $89.2M, +7% Q/Q. Software license revenue rose 65% Y/Y in Q4, a major turnaround from Q3's 25% decline. The company expects 2012 revenue of $500M and EPS of $0.91, compared with a consensus of $490.2M and $0.98. The light EPS guidance is attributed to aggressive sales and R&D spending. PEGA +10.4% AH. (PR - .pdf)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:52 PM
  • STVVY

    China Digital TV Holding (STV): Q4 EPS of $0.19 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $29.2M (-11% Y/Y)...

    China Digital TV Holding (STV): Q4 EPS of $0.19 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $29.2M (-11% Y/Y) misses by $3M. Shares -9.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:39 PM
  • CWT

    California Water Service Group (NYSE:CWT): Q4 EPS of $0.04 misses by $0.14. Revenue of $103M...

    California Water Service Group (NYSE:CWT): Q4 EPS of $0.04 misses by $0.14. Revenue of $103M (-2.4% Y/Y) misses by $14M. Shares -1.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM
  • GLBR

    FXCM +5.7% AH after preannouncing Q4 revenue of $105.2M, above a $101.5M consensus. The forex...

    FXCM +5.7% AH after preannouncing Q4 revenue of $105.2M, above a $101.5M consensus. The forex broker, which will deliver its Q4 report on March 14, also says  its institutional customer trading volume rose 125% Y/Y to $429B, while its retail trading volume rose 16% to $972B. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:34 PM
  • ZIOP

    Ziopharm Oncology (NASDAQ:ZIOP): Q4 EPS of -$0.24 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $0.2M. Shares...

    Ziopharm Oncology (NASDAQ:ZIOP): Q4 EPS of -$0.24 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $0.2M. Shares -2.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM
  • ZUMZ

    Zumiez (NASDAQ:ZUMZ) +4.4% AH after reporting sales for the 4-week period ending Feb. 25 rose...

    Zumiez (NASDAQ:ZUMZ) +4.4% AH after reporting sales for the 4-week period ending Feb. 25 rose 23% Y/Y to $40.2M. Same-store sales rose 14.2%. The sports apparel retailer is expected to report 16.8% Y/Y revenue growth for FQ4 (ended in January), and 12.5% growth for FQ1 (ends in April). (January data)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:24 PM
  • WPRT

    Westport Innovations (NASDAQ:WPRT): FQ3 EPS of -$0.30 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $100.6M (+155%...

    Westport Innovations (NASDAQ:WPRT): FQ3 EPS of -$0.30 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $100.6M (+155% Y/Y) beats by $42M. Shares +2.5% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:22 PM
  • RST

    Rosetta Stone (NYSE:RST): Q4 EPS of -$0.09 may not be comparable to consensus of -$0.28. Revenue...

    Rosetta Stone (NYSE:RST): Q4 EPS of -$0.09 may not be comparable to consensus of -$0.28. Revenue of $80.5M (+8.3% Y/Y) beats by $13M. Shares +1.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:21 PM
  • NKTR

    Nektar Therapeutics (NASDAQ:NKTR): Q4 EPS of -$0.33 beats by $0.14. Revenue of $15.8M (-65% Y/Y)...

    Nektar Therapeutics (NASDAQ:NKTR): Q4 EPS of -$0.33 beats by $0.14. Revenue of $15.8M (-65% Y/Y) beats by $3M. Shares +1.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:15 PM
  • DAR

    More on Darling (NYSE:DAR): Q4 misses Street estimates despite an 89% Y/Y jump in revenue. Sales...

    More on Darling (NYSE:DAR): Q4 misses Street estimates despite an 89% Y/Y jump in revenue. Sales rose to $430.9M versus $227.2M a year ago, primarily due to the acquisition of Griffin Industries in December, as well as higher selling prices for its finished products. Shares +2.1% AH

     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM
  • BWXT

    More on Babcock & Wilcox Company (BWC): Q4 results easily beat estimates on a 13% Y/Y jump...

    More on Babcock & Wilcox Company (BWC): Q4 results easily beat estimates on a 13% Y/Y jump in revenue. Operating income jumped 25%, primarily due to improvements in revenues and operating margins in the Power Generation, Technical Services and Nuclear Operations segments, which partially offset an increase in R&D expenses related to its modular reactor program. Shares up +4.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM
  • PACT

    HiSoft Technology International (HSFT): Q4 EPS of $0.31 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $64.9M (+53%...

    HiSoft Technology International (HSFT): Q4 EPS of $0.31 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $64.9M (+53% Y/Y) beats by $2.5M. Shares +8.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • FNSR

    More on Finisar's (NASDAQ:FNSR) FQ3: Revenue hurt by 3.3% Q/Q drop in sales to telecom market;...

    More on Finisar's (NASDAQ:FNSR) FQ3: Revenue hurt by 3.3% Q/Q drop in sales to telecom market; sales to the datacom (enterprise) market rose 4%. Accounts receivable rose by $8.1M Q/Q. The company expects FQ4 revenue of $235M-$250M and EPS of $0.18-$0.22, below a consensus of $253.5M and $0.25. FNSR -10% AH. JDSU -3.2% in sympathy. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM
  • CSCO

    BroadSoft (BSFT): Q4 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $40.6M (+13.4% Y/Y) in-line. Shares...

    BroadSoft (BSFT): Q4 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $40.6M (+13.4% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -4.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM
  • DAR

    Darling International (NYSE:DAR): Q4 EPS of $0.25 misses by $0.08. Revenue of $431M (+89.7% Y/Y)...

    Darling International (NYSE:DAR): Q4 EPS of $0.25 misses by $0.08. Revenue of $431M (+89.7% Y/Y) beats by $6M. Shares -2.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM
  • BWXT

    Babcock & Wilcox (BWC): Q4 EPS of $0.54 beats by $0.13. Revenue of $801M (+13.6% Y/Y) beats...

    Babcock & Wilcox (BWC): Q4 EPS of $0.54 beats by $0.13. Revenue of $801M (+13.6% Y/Y) beats by $31M. Shares +2.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • MDR

    McDermott International (NYSE:MDR): Q4 EPS of $0.04 misses by $0.16. Revenue of $816M (+51.2%...

    McDermott International (NYSE:MDR): Q4 EPS of $0.04 misses by $0.16. Revenue of $816M (+51.2% Y/Y) misses by $85M. Shares -1.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • DXPE

    DXP Enterprises (NASDAQ:DXPE): Q4 EPS of $0.61 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $219M (+28.7% Y/Y)...

    DXP Enterprises (NASDAQ:DXPE): Q4 EPS of $0.61 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $219M (+28.7% Y/Y) beats by $6M. Shares +2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • FSLR

    Citigroup gives a tepid defense to First Solar's (FSLR -11.6%) poor Q4 results and reduced 2012...

    Citigroup gives a tepid defense to First Solar's (FSLR -11.6%) poor Q4 results and reduced 2012 revenue outlook, saying it believes the guidance is not as bad as it could have been. It does lower its price target by 25% to $45 however, but maintains a Hold rating on the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • BID

    Sotheby's (NYSE:BID): Q4 EPS of $1.04 misses by $0.24. Revenue of $284M (-11% Y/Y) misses by...

    Sotheby's (NYSE:BID): Q4 EPS of $1.04 misses by $0.24. Revenue of $284M (-11% Y/Y) misses by $14M. Shares -3.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • SIRI

    Sirius XM (SIRI +1.4%) finishes the day higher after Citigroup says that Liberty Media (LMCA...

    Sirius XM (SIRI +1.4%) finishes the day higher after Citigroup says that Liberty Media (LMCA +0.5%) may acquire an 80% stake in the company. Citi believes an 80% ownership by Liberty would allow Sirius to use its cash flow to retire the remaining 20% of public float over next four years.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM | 2 Comments
  • FNSR

    Finisar (NASDAQ:FNSR): FQ3 EPS of $0.23 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $243M (-7.6% Y/Y) misses by...

    Finisar (NASDAQ:FNSR): FQ3 EPS of $0.23 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $243M (-7.6% Y/Y) misses by $2.2M. Shares -7.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • CPRT

    Copart (CPRT +8.3%) jumps after easily beating its FQ2 estimates. Per-share earnings jumped...

    Copart (CPRT +8.3%) jumps after easily beating its FQ2 estimates. Per-share earnings jumped nearly 35% Y/Y, despite significant writedowns and impairment charges incurred during the quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM

  • The bottom continues to fall out of precious metals prices, gold off nearly $100/oz., or -5.1%...

    The bottom continues to fall out of precious metals prices, gold off nearly $100/oz., or -5.1% to $1,697. Silver is off $2.55/oz., or -7% to $34.61. The slide began right around the time Bernanke's testimony gave no hint of additional easing, but may have been triggered by algorithms kicking in when a large sell order hit the Treasury pits.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • COST

    Costco (COST +1.2%) sacrificed margins - which fell 30 bps, more than expected - to keep its...

    Costco (COST +1.2%) sacrificed margins - which fell 30 bps, more than expected - to keep its growth engine humming in its FQ2, and investors like the decision. Costco raised its membership fee for the first time in five years, but mostly tried to hold prices down. Citi believes "price investments during the quarter resulted in market share gains and stronger topline growth."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM | 1 Comment
  • JOY

    Joy Global (JOY -6.2%) takes a hit after its FQ1 earnings missed estimates earlier today....

    Joy Global (JOY -6.2%) takes a hit after its FQ1 earnings missed estimates earlier today. Earnings rose 39% Y/Y as the mining-equipment maker continued to report higher revenue and bookings from recent acquisitions, but results missed expectations as a mild winter reduced overall coal demand.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • REPYY

    Spain's Repsol (OTCQX:REPYY -5.6%) follows shares of its Argentine subsidiary YPF sharply lower...

    Spain's Repsol (OTCQX:REPYY -5.6%) follows shares of its Argentine subsidiary YPF sharply lower on worries President Fernandez could announce greater intervention into the oil giant's operations on Thursday. The Argentina ETF: ARGT -2.4% - also taking a hit as YPF no doubt makes up a nice chunk of its holdings.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM
  • NYX

    NYSE Euronext (NYX -1.8%) dips after Raymond James lowers its rating to Outperform from Strong...

    NYSE Euronext (NYX -1.8%) dips after Raymond James lowers its rating to Outperform from Strong on valuation. The stock has been a performer as of late, gaining over 36% since October of last year.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM
  • WCN

    Progressive Waste Solutions (BIN -4.7%) shares slide after missing on Q4 revenues and guiding...

    Progressive Waste Solutions (BIN -4.7%) shares slide after missing on Q4 revenues and guiding FY12 below consensus. RBC Capital was disappointed in BIN's results and guidance, but the firm still thinks the company's business is solid and maintains an Outperform rating; it says shares should be bought below $20.50.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM

  • WTI crude oil (USO) reverses an early plunge in the wake of a bearish inventory report, popping...

    WTI crude oil (USO) reverses an early plunge in the wake of a bearish inventory report, popping more than $2 off the day's low to $107/barrel, +0.3% on the day. Brent crude (BNO) is even stronger, +1% to $122.80.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 2 Comments
  • YPF

    Shares of YPF (YPF -13.4%) plunge after Argentina's Pres. Cristina Fernández de Kirchner...

    Shares of YPF (YPF -13.4%) plunge after Argentina's Pres. Cristina Fernández de Kirchner criticized the energy company for not investing enough money in Argentina. The government is intent on pressuring energy companies, especially YPF, to invest more in order to contain falling production, and there's even talk of nationalization in the air.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM | 1 Comment
  • SAFM

    Goldman recommends aggressively buying Sanderson Farms (SAFM +3.4%) at current levels following...

    Goldman recommends aggressively buying Sanderson Farms (SAFM +3.4%) at current levels following its Q1 report yesterday. The firm says supply reductions support prices going forward, and seasonality is favorable for the stock to post big gains over the near term.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • GLW

    Corning (GLW -2.2%) trades lower after Morgan Stanley reiterates an Underwight, noting downbeat...

    Corning (GLW -2.2%) trades lower after Morgan Stanley reiterates an Underwight, noting downbeat remarks made by CFO James Flaws at a conference. Flaws mentioned his company's Samsung Corning JV (SCP) has chosen not to match a price cut from rival Nippon Electric, and has thus lost share at customer LG Display (NYSE:LPL). As a result, SCP is now expected to see a "low-double-digit" shipment decline. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • CRI

    The holidays weren't kind to many apparel companies, but Carter's (CRI +9.4%) easily beat its...

    The holidays weren't kind to many apparel companies, but Carter's (CRI +9.4%) easily beat its guidance and analyst views. Q4 core EPS surprisingly rose as weaker gross margins were offset by overhead rising less than revenue. Same-store sales grew ~7% for both the namesake and OshKosh chains, and CRI expects solid overall top-line gains for this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM
  • FDML

    Federal-Mogul (FDML +4.2%) gains on positive comments out of Gabelli today, saying the shares...

    Federal-Mogul (FDML +4.2%) gains on positive comments out of Gabelli today, saying the shares should be bought on weakness. The firm expects the company's aftermarket difficulties to mostly disappear by Q2, and should outperform global OE volume over the next five years.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM
  • WMB

    Goldman Sachs reiterates a Buy rating on Williams Cos. (WMB +3%) and adds shares to its...

    Goldman Sachs reiterates a Buy rating on Williams Cos. (WMB +3%) and adds shares to its Conviction Buy list. Goldman cites a combination of above-average 10%-15% dividend growth, "general partner leverage" which should drive long-term sustainable cash flow growth, and a conservative financial profile for its top pick among diversified pipelines.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • LEDS

    Piper reports the Chinese government has introduced its expected LED lighting subsidies, and...

    Piper reports the Chinese government has introduced its expected LED lighting subsidies, and considers the news a "positive catalyst" for the industry. SemiLEDs (LEDS +2.4%), which has Chinese manufacturing facilities, is trading higher. However, other industry players are heading in the opposite direction. CREE -2.6%. RBCN -5.8%. VECO -1.5%. AIXG -3%. GTAT -5.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM
  • RDC

    Rowan Companies (RDC +1.3%) moves up on an upgrade to Buy on valuation at Pritchard and positive...

    Rowan Companies (RDC +1.3%) moves up on an upgrade to Buy on valuation at Pritchard and positive comments out of FBR Capital today. FBR says the pullback offers an attractive entry point, and attributes yesterday's 6% decline to an operational decision to move its legal domicile from Delaware to the U.K., which removes the stock from the S&P index.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • TMUS

    MetroPCS (PCS -5.8%) adds to yesterday's losses after Nomura starts coverage with a Neutral, and...

    MetroPCS (PCS -5.8%) adds to yesterday's losses after Nomura starts coverage with a Neutral, and adds it has a "negatively biased outlook" for the prepaid wireless market. While considering MetroPCS better positioned than rival Leap Wireless (LEAP - also started at Neutral), it expects shares to be at the mercy of industry pricing trends.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • SYKE

    First Analysis piles on to Sykes Enterprises (SYKE -3.2%), downgrading the shares on the back of...

    First Analysis piles on to Sykes Enterprises (SYKE -3.2%), downgrading the shares on the back of its Q4 report due to weak guidance and revenue growth concerns.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM
  • OAS

    Deutsche Bank is taking a more defensive stance on oil-levered stocks due to valuation concerns...

    Deutsche Bank is taking a more defensive stance on oil-levered stocks due to valuation concerns and its weaker outlook for crude oil. The firm cuts Oasis Petroleum (OAS -3.9%), Marathon Oil (MRO -2.9%), Murphy Oil (MUR -0.8%) and Canadian Natural (CNQ -1%) all to Hold.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • SGMS

    Shares of Scientific Games (SGMS -11.1%) slip after the firm underwhelms investors with its Q4...

    Shares of Scientific Games (SGMS -11.1%) slip after the firm underwhelms investors with its Q4 report due to expenses and restructuring costs that came in higher than expected.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM
  • QUAD

    Quad/Graphics (QUAD +17%) jumps after reporting Q4 revenue of $1.22B (-5% Y/Y) and EPS from...

    Quad/Graphics (QUAD +17%) jumps after reporting Q4 revenue of $1.22B (-5% Y/Y) and EPS from continuing operations of $0.19. The printing services firm notes its 2011 recurring free cash flow of $340M exceeded guidance of $260M-$300M, and is raising its dividend by $0.05/share to $0.25/share. It expects 2012 revenue of $4B, and free cash flow of $300M. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney (JCP -2.5%) dips after saying February sales will come in below expectations....

    J.C. Penney (JCP -2.5%) dips after saying February sales will come in below expectations. Cleveland Research notes that the company continues to struggle as market share losses rise unabated.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM | 1 Comment

  • Big moves (i, ii, iii, iv) in a number of markets just after Bernanke's testimony was released...

    Big moves (i, ii, iii, iv) in a number of markets just after Bernanke's testimony was released this morning may have been spurred by an unusually large sell order hitting the Treasury market which then caused algorithms from precious metals, to currencies, to stocks to fly into action, sending all the markets reeling. It may have been a fat-finger, but one trader suspects it was "a very big asset allocation."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM | 9 Comments
  • ITT

    ITT (ITT +2.91%) gains after beating Q4 revenue estimates earlier today. Revenue was up 10% Y/Y,...

    ITT (ITT +2.91%) gains after beating Q4 revenue estimates earlier today. Revenue was up 10% Y/Y, as core profits improved despite spinoff expenses that masked better-than-expected revenue growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR -10.1%) is now falling hard after badly missing Q4 estimates and slashing...

    First Solar (FSLR -10.1%) is now falling hard after badly missing Q4 estimates and slashing guidance, and is taking its peers down with it (TAN -3.3%). Cantor Fitzgerald, which has long been bearish, says it has no confidence in First Solar's guidance, and believes 2013 will be worse than 2012. Goldman is staying positive, citing a low valuation and First Solar's ability to achieve a lower cost structure than Chinese rivals. (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM
  • HZNP

    Horizon Pharma (HZNP -2.5%) moves lower following a premarket trading halt tied to an...

    Horizon Pharma (HZNP -2.5%) moves lower following a premarket trading halt tied to an announcement of a private placement of 14M units by the company at a price of $3.62 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM
  • PSS

    Caris adds to the upside in Collective Brands (PSS +5%) this morning, upgrading the stock to...

    Caris adds to the upside in Collective Brands (PSS +5%) this morning, upgrading the stock to Above Average post-Q4 results. Caris says the company is showing signs of a turnaround.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • CTCT

    Constant Contact (CTCT -2.2%), which up 38% YTD as of Tuesday's close, is heading lower, perhaps...

    Constant Contact (CTCT -2.2%), which up 38% YTD as of Tuesday's close, is heading lower, perhaps on account of Vocus' (VOCS -38%) acquisition of rival iContact. The selloff is occurring in spite of bullish comments from Oppenheimer, which believes the company's recently-announced SaveLocal daily deals platform is differentiated enough in terms of pricing and merchant control to "see solid uptake."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • ODP

    Jefferies raises its price target for Office Depot (ODP -4.7%) to $4 from $2.50 after digesting...

    Jefferies raises its price target for Office Depot (ODP -4.7%) to $4 from $2.50 after digesting the firm's Q4 results and commentary from management. Analysts say the company's restructuring continues to cloud the firm's profit picture, but see improving sales and cash flow trends.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM
  • IRWD

    Ironwood Pharmaceuticals (IRWD -6.2%) takes a hit this morning, despite posting...

    Ironwood Pharmaceuticals (IRWD -6.2%) takes a hit this morning, despite posting better-than-expected Q4 results after the close yesterday. Cantor downgraded the shares to Sell on the report, citing a lack of revenue strength, reduced promotional spending, growing operating expenses and its current high valuation.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM | 1 Comment
  • CZR

    Select casino stocks show strength on a weak market day, helped along with favorable comments...

    Select casino stocks show strength on a weak market day, helped along with favorable comments from Caesars Entertainment (CZR +1.4%) on Las Vegas gaming revenue. Gainers: WYNN +3%, LVS +1.3%, BYD +1.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM

  • Precious metals fall off a cliff as well as it becomes clear no new candy is imminently...

    Precious metals fall off a cliff as well as it becomes clear no new candy is imminently forthcoming from the Fed. Gold -2.3% to $1,747/oz., Silver -2.5% to $36.22/oz. Oil slides too, -0.6% to $105.94. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM | 3 Comments

  • "No clear signal that the (FOMC) is considering further monetary easing," is Goldman's...

    "No clear signal that the (FOMC) is considering further monetary easing," is Goldman's Jan Hatzius' take on the Bernanke testimony. Other than the Chairman's reputation for easy money, what led anyone to believe QE3 or its ilk was to be announced today? Stocks throw a minor fit, the DJIA -0.5%, and the euro continues to slide, -0.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM | 14 Comments
  • CZR

    Caesars Entertainment (CZR +1.6%) trades higher after reporting Q4 revenue of $2.172B (+0.2%...

    Caesars Entertainment (CZR +1.6%) trades higher after reporting Q4 revenue of $2.172B (+0.2% Y/Y, +2.4% Q/Q). While certain regional domestic markets underperformed, Las Vegas was a winner led by international players, according to CEO Gary Loveman.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • NRG

    GenOn Energy (GEN +8.6%) anticipates that it will have to shut down 13% of its generating...

    GenOn Energy (GEN +8.6%) anticipates that it will have to shut down 13% of its generating capacity by May 2015 in order to comply with environmental regulations.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • FARO

    FARO Technologies (FARO -2.1%) is trading lower this morning after Baird cut the shares to...

    FARO Technologies (FARO -2.1%) is trading lower this morning after Baird cut the shares to Neutral on the back of its Q4 results released yesterday. Baird says the numbers were in-line with estimates, but the stock but its outlook offers only limited upside going forward.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • TOL

    Toll Brothers (TOL +3.9%) rallies after ebullient CEO Douglas Yearly tells CNBC he sees...

    Toll Brothers (TOL +3.9%) rallies after ebullient CEO Douglas Yearly tells CNBC he sees "improvement everywhere," adding that his company feels "the best" it has in five years. Although TOL reported a FQ1 loss, Yearly says orders were up 43% in the first three weeks of February. Rival homebuilders also jump: PHM +3.9%, DHI +2.7%, LEN +2.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM | 2 Comments
  • AAPL

    Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) market cap passes $500B, making it the the first U.S. company to top that...

    Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) market cap passes $500B, making it the the first U.S. company to top that level since Exxon in 2008. Apple has risen 34% in 2012, but with a PE multiple of 12 times this year’s expected earnings, a new iPad and possibly phone on the way, not to mention a potential dividend, the bulls are charging. Shares +1.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM | 2 Comments
  • SODA

    The falloff in SodaStream (SODA -15.5%) following its Q4 earnings triple play doesn't reverse...

    The falloff in SodaStream (SODA -15.5%) following its Q4 earnings triple play doesn't reverse itself after the firm's relatively tame earnings CC.
